snippet: Newt Gingrich’s call for a commission to examine a return to the gold standard has a familiar ring. Ronald Reagan did the same more than 30 years ago.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column observes that Newt Gingrich's call for a commission to examine a return to the gold standard has a familiar ring, in that Ronald Reagan did the same in 1981; points out even if Gingrich is serious about following Reagan's precedent, there would be little chance of a move to gold even if Gingrich wins the Republican nomination and the November election.
lead_paragraph: Newt Gingrich’s call for a commission to examine a return to the gold standard has a familiar ring. Ronald Reagan did the same more than 30 years ago.
